IN THE COURT OF THE JUDICIAL I CLASS MAGISTRATE-V,
(SPECIAL COURT FOR MARK LIST CASES), THIRUVANANTHAPURAM.
Present:- Smt. Aswathy.S, Judicial First Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
Tuesday the 21 day of January, 2025./ 1* Makha, 1946.
CG. 353/2018
Complainant : State represented by the Sub Inspector of Police, Thumba Police
Station in Crime No. 489/2013.
(By Assistant Public Prosecutor)
Accused : 1. Ramachandran Nair, aged 50 years, S/o. Sankaran Nair,
Sreehari Nilayam, TC. 1/1110/(1), Manjamkonam,
Kulathoor Ward, Attipra Village.
2. Rajesh Kumar, aged 56 years, S/o. Thankappan Nair,
Sreehari Nilayam, TC. 1/1110/(1), Manjamkonam,
Kulathoor Ward, Attipra Village.
(By Advocate Sri. V.S.Bhasurendran Nair)
Charge : Offences punishable under sections 447, 294(b), 323 and 324
t/w.34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.
Plea : Not guilty
Finding : Not guilty
Sentence : Accused numbers 1 and 2 are found not guilty of offences
punishable under sections 447, 294(b), 323 and 324 r/w.34 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860 and they are acquitted of the said
offences under section 248(1) Code of Criminal Procedure,
1973. Their bail bonds stand cancelled and they are set at liberty.
Description of accused
1. Ramachandran | Sankaran Nair 50 |Attipra Village | Thiruvananthapuram
Nair
2. Rajesh Kumar |Thankappan Nair Attipra Village | Thiruvananthapuram

2 of 6

16.01.2025 18.01.2025 21.01.2025
This case having been finally heard on today the court on the same day delivered the
following :-
JUDGMENT
1. Accused stands trial for offences punishable under sections 447, 294(b), 323
and 324 r/w.34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860
2. The prosecution case in brief is as follows :- On 21.11.2012,, at 9.30 pm, at
Nirmalalayam Convent Thekkekunnu road Manvila, Kulathoor Ward, Attipra
Village, the accused no.1 by using a wooden piece struck on the head of CW1,
resulting in injury. Thus the accused Nos. 1 and 2 thereby committed offenses
wss. 447, 294(b), 323 and 324 r/w.34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860
3. Final report was filed by the Sub Inspector of police, Thumba_ police station
before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I, Thiravananthapuram and
the case was taken on file as C.C. 489/2013. Cognizance was taken for the
offences punishable u/s. 447, 294(b), 323 and 324 r/w.34 of Indian Penal Code,

3 of 6
1860 against the accused persons. Thereafter, it was transferred to this court, in
pursuance of the order of the Hon'ble Chief Judicial Magistrate,
Thiruvananthapuram, the case was refiled as CC. 353/2018.

4. On appearance of the accused Nos. 1 and 2 they were enlarged on bail on
23.11.2012. Copies of all relevant prosecution records were furnished to them
under section 207 Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. After hearing
prosecution and counsel for accused Nos. 1 and 2, charge framed for offences
wss. 447, 294(b), 323 and 324 r/w.34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860, read over
and explained to the accused Nos. 1 and 2 to which they pleaded not guilty and
claimed to be tried.

5. On the side of prosecution, PW1 was examined and Exhibit P1 was marked.
As the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the learned
Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW2 to CW7. In the absence of any
incriminating circumstances against the accused Nos. 1 and 2, questioning of
the accused Nos. 1 and 2, under section 313(1)(b) Code of Criminal Procedure,
1973 was dispensed with. Accused Nos. 1 and 2 were called upon to adduce
evidence but no defence evidence was adduced from the side of the accused
Nos. 1 and 2.

6. Heard both sides and perued records.

4 of 6

7. The following points have arisen for determination:

(1) Whether on 21.11.2012,, at 9.30 pm, Nirmalalayam Convent Thekkekunnu
road Manvila, Kulathoor Ward, Attipra Village,accused nos.1 and 2
trespassed and thereby committed an offence punishable under section 447
r/w. 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 ?

(2) Whether on the same time and place, accused Nos. 1 and 2 infurtherance of
their common intention, accused No.2 uttered obscene words towards PW1,
which is in or near the public place and have thereby committed offence
punishable under section 294(b) read with 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860?

(3) Whether on the same time and place, infurtherance of their common
intention of accused Nos. 1 and 2 , voluntarily caused hurt to CW1 and have
thereby committed offence punishable under section 323 read with 34 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860 ?

(4) Whether on the same time and place accused Nos. 1 and 2 infurtherance of
their common intention, accused No.1 beat CW1 with a wooden piece on
his head resulting in injury and have thereby committed offence punishable
under section 324 read with 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 ?

(5) If the accused Nos. 1 and 2 are found guilty? What is the order as to
sentence?

8. Point Nos. 1 to 4 :-To avoid repetition and for brevity, point nos. 1 to 4 are
considered together. Prosecution case is that accused have committed offences
punishable under sections 447, 294(b), 323 and 324 r/w.34 of Indian Penal
Code, 1860.

9. PW1, Binoy P Thomas deposed that, he had given statement before the police
regarding the alleged incident of this case and he identified his signature in the
first information statement which is marked as Ext. P1. According to him the

5 of 6
accused persons were not assaulted him and he has no grievance against the
accused persons.

10. The learned Assistant Public Prosecutor had given up other witnesses and he is
justified in doing so as the material witness did not support the case of
prosecution. Having considered evidence on record, this court is of the view
that prosecution has failed to prove the guilt of accused Nos. 1 and 2 and for
the said reason these points are found against the prosecution.

11. Point No. 5 :- Upon the finding in point Nos. 1 to 4 the accused Nos. 1 and 2
are found not guilty of offences punishable under sections 447, 294(b), 323 and
324 r/w.34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and they are acquitted for the said
offences under section 248(1) of Criminal Procedure Code 1973. Their bail
bonds stand cancelled and they are set at liberty.

No material objects are produced in this case.
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected by me
and pronounced in the open court on this the 21° day of January, 2025.
Sd/-
Judicial I Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.

6 of 6
